Package com.intellij.diff.comparison

Class ComparisonManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.diff.comparison.ComparisonManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComparisonManagerImpl

    public abstract class ComparisonManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for the text comparison CharSequences should to have '\n' as line separator

    It's good idea not to compare String due to expensive subSequence() implementation. Use CharSequenceSubSequence.

      • squash

        public abstract java.util.List<LineFragment> squash(java.util.List<LineFragment> oldFragments)
        compareLinesInner() comparison can produce adjustment line chunks. This method allows to squash shem. ex: "A\nB" vs "A X\nB Y" will result to two LineFragments: [0, 1) - [0, 1) and [1, 2) - [1, 2) squash will produce a single fragment: [0, 2) - [0, 2)

      • processBlocks

        public abstract java.util.List<LineFragment> processBlocks(java.util.List<LineFragment> oldFragments,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence text1,
                                                           java.lang.CharSequence text2,
                                                           ComparisonPolicy policy,
                                                           boolean squash,
                                                           boolean trim)
        Parameters:
        trim - - if leading/trailing LineFragments with equal contents should be skipped
        See Also:
        squash(java.util.List<com.intellij.diff.fragments.LineFragment>)
